alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 1:58PM CDT until May 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC011-015-017-039-250700- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.Y.0011.000000T0000Z-220525T1800Z/ /BRIO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 158 PM CDT Tue May 24 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The river remains within its banks in southern Blaine... northern Caddo... and southwestern Canadian counties. Low-lying bottomlands near the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 10.8 feet and begin rising again early Thursday morning. It will rise to 11.1 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
